commander.name: Major-General Ivor Hughes
commander.previous_service: Commanded 131st Infantry Brigade until March 1942, succeeded Brian Horrocks as GOC 44th Division

command.headquarters_location: El Alamein sector, Egypt - XIII Corps southern sector

Ordnance QF 6-pounder (57mm).note: Modern anti-tank gun equipped before North Africa deployment

supply_logistics.supply_status: GOOD - Fresh division with full equipment allocation. Integrated into 8th Army supply system upon arrival. Static defensive position in XIII Corps southern sector allows stockpiling. Supply from Alexandria via coastal road.

weather_environment.terrain_type: Western Desert - Southern El Alamein sector (XIII Corps). Mix of sand, rock, and camel scrub. More difficult terrain than northern sector.

subordinate_units.note: Battalions: 1/5th, 1/6th, 1/7th Queen's Royal Regiment (West Surrey). Participated in Operation Braganza 29-30 September 1942.
Battalions: 1/7th Queen's Royal Regiment, 4th and 5th Queen's Own Royal West Kent Regiment
Battalions: 2nd, 4th, and 5th (Cinque Ports) Royal Sussex Regiment

tactical_doctrine.role: Infantry division in XIII Corps southern sector at Second Battle of El Alamein. Mission: Support 7th Armoured Division operations, hold defensive positions, prevent Axis breakthrough from southern sector.
special_capabilities: Fresh division with full strength and modern equipment
Territorial Army units with strong regional cohesion (Home Counties)
Well-trained in UK before North Africa deployment
Modern 6-pounder anti-tank guns in good supply
tactical_innovations: Operation Braganza (29-30 September) - night raid by 131st Brigade before main battle
Adaptation to desert warfare during acclimatization period (June-September 1942)
Integration with veteran 7th Armoured Division in XIII Corps
known_issues: First action in North Africa - limited desert warfare experience
Arrived mid-1942 - only 4-5 months acclimatization before El Alamein

tactical_doctrine.desert_adaptations: Limited desert warfare experience. Division deployed to North Africa May 29, 1942. Underwent desert acclimatization and training June-September 1942. First combat action: Operation Braganza (Sep 29-30) and Second Battle of El Alamein (Oct 23). Still adapting to desert conditions in Q4 1942.
